item.title: G7 Urges Financial Sector to Prepare for Quantum Computing Threat
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group (CEG), co-chaired by the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Bank of England, has issued a public statement and roadmap advising the global financial sector to begin a coordinated transition to quantum-resilient technology. The guidance warns that advanced quantum compu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cyber-Fraud Now Top Global Threat, Surpassing Ransomware, WEF Report Finds
item.description:
The World Economic Forum's (WEF) 'Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2026' report, produced with Accenture, reveals a major shift in the threat landscape: cyber-enabled fraud and phishing have now surpassed ransomware as the top concern for global business leaders. The report highlights that fraud has rea...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: High-Severity Code Injection Flaw in Open WebUI (CVE-2025-64496) Allows RCE
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-64496, has been discovered in Open WebUI, a popular self-hosted interface for large language models (LLMs). The flaw, found by Cato Networks, allows a malicious AI server to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into a user's browser session. This can be...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Financial Sector Warned of Systemic Supply Chain Risk and 'Indirect Ransomware'
item.description:
A new threat intelligence report for 2025-2026 reveals a perilous cyber landscape for the financial sector, dominated by systemic supply chain risks and evolving ransomware tactics. Citing data that 97% of U.S. banks were breached via third-party suppliers in 2024, the report underscores the critica...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack, Policy and Compliance

item.title: YARA-X Update Helps Analysts Avoid Flawed Detection Rules
item.description:
Version 1.11.0 of YARA-X, a popular tool for malware analysis, has been released with a key enhancement aimed at improving the accuracy of detection rules. The update introduces 'hash function warnings,' a feature that alerts security analysts when they make common errors in hash string comparisons,...

Categories: Security Operations, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Lapsus$ Hacking Group Is Back with Evolved Extortion Tactics
item.description:
The notorious Lapsus$ extortion group, known for its high-profile breaches of major tech companies, has reportedly resurfaced. According to a threat intelligence report from January 7, 2026, remnants of the group have reformed and evolved, integrating tactics from other cybercriminal operations. The...

item.title: Ransomware Goes Global, Targeting New Regions and Industries with Weaker Defenses
item.description:
Ransomware is becoming a more globalized and unpredictable threat, according to the H2 2025 Global Threat Briefing from cyber analytics firm CyberCube. The report warns that ransomware groups are actively expanding into new geographic regions and industry sectors that have historically seen fewer at...

item.title: Taiwan Reports 2.6 Million Daily Cyberattacks from China in 2025
item.description:
Taiwan's National Security Bureau (NSB) released a report on January 4, 2026, detailing a massive and sustained cyber offensive by Chinese state-backed actors throughout 2025. The island faced an average of 2.63 million cyberattacks daily, a 6% increase from 2024 and double the rate of 2023. The att...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

item.title: A Look Inside the CVE Process: The Story of a Rejected ID
item.description:
On January 3, 2026, the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) officially updated the status of CVE-2025-34775 to 'REJECTED'. This status indicates that while the identifier was reserved by a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA), it was ultimately not used for a public vulnerability disclosure. This can occ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Other, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Resecurity Turns Tables on Hackers, Claims Breach Was a Honeypot
item.description:
Cybersecurity firm Resecurity has publicly refuted claims of a major data breach made by a hacking group known as 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' (SLH). On January 3, 2026, the group announced on Telegram that it had compromised Resecurity's systems, stealing internal data and client information. Resecu...
